metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: John Mead Howes, Esq.   The Paza  New York, N. Y.   Dear Mr. Howes:  Thank you for your letter of December 16th. Today I received a letter from Mr. Keppe of December 14th. He had not seen you when it was written. He enclosed a copy of a ong letter from Mr. Omsted to Mr. William Emerson. I have also received a letter from Mr. Omsted but I am not sending you copies of these etters now as I hope you will be in Charleston soon.  I won"t argue further about your being chairman of this suggested committtee. I do understand your reasons even though I do not agree. I am deighted that you will be on the committee.  I am certain that your letter to Mr. Keppe helps enormousy and it was most generous of you to place Charleston first. I believe it will bear much weight with Mr. Keppe as he knows of your special interest in Portsmouth and the other places you mentioned.  I am anxiousy awaiting an opportunity to discuss a these things with you; in the meantime a very merry Christmas to you and a of your famiy.   Sincerely yours,  Robert N. S. Whitelaw,   Director  rnsw; em
